section.p: Five elderly priests in long robes are walking down the lane just ahead. Catching up, you ask them where they are bound.
‘We travel all over Golnir,’ says the oldest, ‘teaching people about the gods.’
‘You must have met some strange sorts in your time.’
He nods. ‘Indeed. The most intractable were the bald folk of the Forsaken Forest. They attack and murder anyone who has a head of hair, scalping them to make wigs.’
‘And do not forget the citizens of Dweomer,’ chimes in the youngest priest, a fellow of about sixty. ‘They admire godlessness as if it were a virtue.’
